channel.title: ASPNET MVC on Jef Claes
channel.description: Recent content in ASPNET MVC on Jef Claes

item.title: Sending commands from a knockout.js view model
item.description: While I got to use angular.js for a good while last year, I found myself returning to knockout.js for the current application I’m working on. Where angular.js is a heavy, intrusive, opinionated, but also very complete framework, knockout.js is a small and lightweight library giving you not much more than a dynamic model binder. So instead of blindly following the angular-way, I’ll have to introduce my own set of abstractions and plumbing again; I assume that I’ll end up with a lot less.
